sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews Now. Here are our top stories this hour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russia claims to be in full control of the Luhansk area of Ukraine as key forces retreat from one of their last strongholds in Lysyshank to avoid fatal consequences.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Three people have died after a gunman opened fire in one of Denmark's biggest shopping centres.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Danish police rule out terrorism and say he most likely acted alone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Despite the ongoing war, discussions on the reconstruction of Ukraine begin in earnest as leaders gathered in Lugano, Switzerland for a donor conference.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russian troops are claiming a major victory in the key strategic city of Lysychansk in eastern Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Their apparent control would seem to be confirmed by a retreat of Ukrainian forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Kiev's withdrawal follows weeks of fierce fighting and marks a decisive breakthrough for Moscow more than four months after its invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Lysychansk had been the last major city in the Luhansk area of the eastern Donbass region, still in Ukrainian hands, and its capture frees up Moscow's forces to advance on Kramatorsk and Slovyansk in neighboring Donetsk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The blow to Ukrainian resistance came after the Australian Prime Minister, Antony Albanese, on Sunday pledged further military support during a meeting with President Zelensky in Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But the Ukrainian president has conceded that Russian troops are making gains.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: ANTONY ALBANESE, Australian Prime Minister There are risks that the Luhansk region will be completely occupied. There are such risks and they are understood by us. Australia's Prime Minister had earlier visited Irpin, one of the war-ravaged towns in Ukraine's Kiev region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He said it had been devastating to see residential buildings destroyed from the result of shelling and called it a war crime.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's Prime Minister and Foreign Minister have arrived in the Swiss city of Lugano for

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: the start of a conference on rebuilding Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Leaders from dozens of countries and international organizations are attending the two-day gathering.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen will also attend the event.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The aim is to look at the priorities for reconstruction of war-torn Ukraine, even as its war with Russia continues to rage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The conference had been planned well before the Kremlin launched its full-scale invasion on February 24.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It had been slated to discuss reforms in Ukraine, but the emphasis has now changed to reconstruction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It will give Kyiv the chance to share its own recovery plan and discuss with countries, organizations and the private sector how best to address the towering challenges ahead. While, strictly speaking, not a donor conference, it will underline the broad international support for Ukraine's reconstruction process. President Zelensky is expected to participate via video link.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Steel production continues in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: While the sprawling Azovstal factory in the key city of Mariupol fell to Russian forces mid-May, work continues from another site 300 kilometers away at the Kabalstal plant, where the 500 workers transferred here when the Azovstal complex became the target of invading troops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Dimitro Lipa, the director of the plant, says Azovstal became a symbol of our country, of our fight against the enemy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I am proud to work for Metinvest Holdings, which includes the Azovstal plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Seeing that example, we do our job.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And that helps us believe in the future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We believe in our victory." Kamatstal produces several tons of steel every day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: However, the plant has been forced to reduce its yields due to logistical issues and high transportation costs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We are working on this, he says.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We are reducing production costs, but we are losing in competitiveness.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We have three furnaces in this plant, but unfortunately only one of them is working today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We have reduced our output by two-thirds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We are losing a lot of money.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Moscow's blockade on Ukraine's Black Sea ports means Kamysdal's stock is piling up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Without means to export, bosses are now under pressure to find new transportation routes, reduce production and salvage profits.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The 29th meeting of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe Parliamentary Assembly has gotten underway over the weekend in the UK's second city Birmingham. Delegations from some 57 nations will spend the next few days until Wednesday talking about the biggest threats to security. The delegations themselves come not just from Europe but also from Central Asia and North America as well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Top of the agenda for them is, of course, the war in Ukraine, what can be done to help President Zelensky's government and his forces in the face of that Russian aggression.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Also, the aggression being posed by Russia on its neighbours, the problems as well involving journalists working in war zones, the progress on achieving Millennium Development Goals and even the acceleration to climate carbon neutral energy sources because of course so many economies in the West dependent on getting their oil from countries which have dubious records when it comes to human rights and other issues. Now those delegations will continue the discussions throughout the next few days. One delegation not there, though, is from Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They were barred entry to the UK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They didn't get the necessary visas because many of them are on sanctions lists, both in the European Union and here in the United Kingdom.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It is also the first time that these nations have been able to meet since 2019 because of the pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They held virtual summits, but this will very much be a chance for some soft diplomacy as well in the background. Vincent McIverney, Euronews, London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This is the moment a gunman opened fire in one of Denmark's biggest shopping centres.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Three people have died and others have been wounded, three critically.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A 22-year-old man has been arrested and charged with the attack at Fields Mall in South Copenhagen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Suddenly we heard shots.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I think I heard ten shots and then we ran through the shopping center and ended up in a toilet where we huddled together. There were around 11 people. I was really hot and we waited and we were really scared. It's been a terrible experience.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Many had been in the area for a Harry Styles concert that was later canceled. Hans Christian Stoltz brought his two daughters to the gig.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's pure terror. This is awful, you know. You might wonder how a person could do this to other human beings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Police say terrorism has now been ruled out and that the gunman suffers from mental health issues. They're urging shop owners to keep any video surveillance footage they might have but add no other attackers appear to be involved.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The attack comes just more than a week after a gunman opened fire outside a gay bar in neighbouring Norway, killing two people and wounding 21 others.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Six people are dead and nine injured after a large chunk of an alpine glacier broke loose and roared down a mountainside in Italy, sending ice, rock and snow slamming into hikers on a popular trail.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Authorities say there are at least 17 confirmed missing in the Marmolada Range in the largest Dolomite mountains in north-east Italy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It is not immediately clear what caused the section of the ice to break away, but an intense heat wave has gripped the country since late June could be a factor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Five helicopters and dozens of alpine search and rescue specialists have been deployed to the scene.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They say blocks of ice are continuing to tumble down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The engines have been flown to several hospitals nearby as search for those missing carries on. Tens of thousands of people held a rally in Georgia demanding the government resign over

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: its failure to secure candidacy for membership of the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Black Sea nation has been in a grip of mass protest since EU leaders decided in late June to defer Tbilisi's application pending sweeping political reforms.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: More than a million people turned out for the Cologne Pride Parade on Sunday, either to take part or watch the colorful performances.
